title: How to add bootstrap to an angular-cli project
body:
You can use Native Angular2 directives for Bootstrap, works with Bootstrap 3 and 4-alfa. More about ng2-bootstrap

First go to the project directory and type

npm install ng2-bootstrap --save

then open your angular-cli-build.js and add this line

vendorNpmFiles: [
   ..................
   'ng2-bootstrap/**/*.js',
    ....................
  ]

now open your src/system-config.ts, write 

const map:any ={
     ..................
   'ng2-bootstrap': 'vendor/ng2-bootstrap',
    ....................

}

and 

const packages: any = {
  'ng2-bootstrap': {
    format: 'cjs',
    defaultExtension: 'js',
    main: 'ng2-bootstrap.js'

  }

};

Edit:

It is for other 3rd party libraries - If you dont get any npm for your third-party libraries. Make an assets folder under your src folder. Then you can add separate folders for js,css and images. Put your third-party js inside the jsfolder. Then you have to reference js file in your index.html like this way:

<script src="assets/js/your_js.js"></script>

Now, when you do ng serve or ng build it will automatically update the public folder with your assets/js. Hope it helps :)
